name: Holiday Inn Laguna Beach

reviews.text: If you set your expectations that you are in Laguna Beach, across from the ocean, and that you won't be in your room often, then this is a perfect hotel for you. Our team was on business and opted for the Holiday Inn Express in Laguna Beach because of its location and price. We looked at other (off brand) hotels in the area and the reviews looks bad on tripadvisor.com. We were really happy that the beds were comfortable and everything was walking distance away. Check in was fast and the hotel was in good shape. This is not a $300-$400 level place, so set your expectations right. It's a fun hotel that is perfect for business, solo, or group of friends.
reviews.title: Typical (Good) Mainstream Beach Hotel
Hospitality
reviews.text: Just wanted to say we had a lovely stay here. The front desk was so helpful and really friendly. Great staff. My kids loved the complimentary lemonade. I loved easy access to bottled water and coffee. The hotel is not large, but the lobby area is a really nice meeting place. I was happy every time I walked in the door. The flowers really make the hotel and it is nice to see that a small space can be so inviting. I will say the rooms are smallish but the excellent location outweighs this as a concern for me. We ran to the grocery store quite a few times so that was very handy. We could walk to great restaurants and the beach was just across the street. Good value all around.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in suite, room 49. It was very roomy and comfortable. The bathroom is quite big, almost as big as the bedroom, with a step-up whirlpool tub/shower, but only one sink. The hotel is centered around a pool courtyard and the rooms can only be accessed through locked gates or staffed lobby. (the pool must be original to the hotel, as it is eight feetdeep, but in good shape with nice tiles.) The one very unfortunate aspect of our stay, was the knocking sound all night because even a slight breeze caused the gate right under our room, to rattle every few minutes. Otherwise the hotel is very solid and quiet. Some of the rooms have balconets on the outside of the building.
reviews.title: Nice old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. A Holiday Inn with a bit of a boutique hotel feel. Nice rooms, comfortable bed. Only thing is the carpet is alittle dated.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: Very good location, within walking distance to the beach, all the good restaurants and shopping destinations. There is also a supermarket across the street.
reviews.title: Great location in laguna

reviews.text: We stayed there with friends in November 2011, The hotel was very nice and conveniently located at the Laguna Beach, just across the street from the beach. The rooms are around a courtyard with a nice pool. There are complimentary drinks and some snacks (pop corn) at the reception area. The parking is behind the hotel and is free of charge. The rooms are ok. The staff was ok too. What they call "fitness center" is just a small room with a couple of machines :-)
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it's a nice hotel if you don't expect much.
reviews.title: Noisy aircon, noisy lounge bar, good location

reviews.text: Location is good, a short walk from both downtown Laguna Beach and Aliso Creek. Staff were friendly and efficient in the most part. The most upsetting part of our stay however was not being told their restaurant \ lounge is open until 2am and turns into a dance \ music bar with very loud music. Our room was right next to this so we could not sleep as a result - we were moved to another room the next day as the hotel was quiet.
reviews.title: location, location, location

reviews.text: The hotel walls are thin and so noise from adjacent rooms is very audible. There are aircon \ extractor fans fitted to all of the upper level rooms. This equipment is very old as it rattles, whines and generally makes a lot of noise for 18 hours per day.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel - STRONGLY recommended!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms themselves were adequate if a little tired. Cleanliness was OK. WIFI was free and decent quality. There are no in room safes but you leave your valubles at reception. Parking is available for a fee - $10 per day. For this area, that was good value as most hotels were valet park only at $20 to $30. Pool area was OK in a nice courtyard. Free tea \ coffee \ water & Pepsi and fresh popcorn were available in the lobby which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, courteous staff!

reviews.text: I took my niece to Laguna Beach for her 12th birthday. This hotel is in an ideal location. It's right across from the beach and a grocery store. There is shopping and restaurants within walking distance, in both directions. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is small and quaint, very clean, and well kept. Our room was a bit cramped with the 2 queen beds, but we spent so little time there it didn't matter. The room was also surprisingly quiet. I was able to look at a room that had just a king bed and it seemed much larger. Our bathroom was quite nice... with a huge tile shower. The pool is in the center of the hotel - with all rooms wrapping around it. It was clean and a good temp. I was a bit disappointed that there was no hot tub.
reviews.title: Great location... nice staff

reviews.text: The restaurant/bar below the hotel is a blast. I think it's called the Bamboo Room. The food and drinks were great. The manager and her boyfriend run the place and are exceptionally sweet. The gave us lots of great ideas for places to visit and restaurants to try.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay
The Holiday Inn
reviews.text: If I was to go back to Laguna Beach I'd definitely stay at this hotel again.

We love the location along PCH, across the street from the beach and Ralphs grocery next door. The hotel room is clean overlooking a mediterranean-style courtyard with pool surrounded by lush plants and flowers. We travel to Southern Cal once or twice a year to visit relatives and always include a stay at Holiday Inn Laguna Beach.
reviews.title: Affordable Laguna
Great Laguna Beach getaway location
reviews.text: This is a lovely family hotel with an awesome location – it’s as close to the beach as you can get without the premium price. Located at the corner of Cleo and PCH, the Cleo Street Beach is not more than 150M away. Despite the proximity to the highway the noise was not an issue; all rooms face on to the courtyard and the quiet hum of the air conditioners drowned out any offending noise. Our room was the standard hotel room with 2 double beds – but had a wonderful bathroom with a slate tiled shower (the shower and the toilet were separate from the washbasin; this is a great scenario when you have a family of 4), however, there was no bathtub (if this is important for you). Things to appreciate included the little things like the pool area in the courtyard, the refreshments and popcorn machine in the lobby (our children filled many a bag) and the proximity to Ralph’s (groceries), The Orange Inn (morning coffee), Taco Loco (great Shrimp taco), Costa Azul and Girl in the Curl (surfing lessons). Things to consider? Parking is an additional charge of $6 per day (would cost double if you had to drive to the beach and park).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach for ten days from March 19 to 29, 2012. I am Priority Club Platinum member and I decided to use my reward points for a California vacation, using this hotel as our home base. As others have said, you can't fault this hotel in terms of basic amenities, cleanliness and location. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of all that Laguna Beach has to offer.
reviews.title: Nice, but not "suite".

reviews.text: My only beef with the hotel is that they refused to upgrade us to a suite even though I am a Platinum member. We were given a standard courtyard room on the second level, which was small and not suited to an extended stay. When I asked at the front desk about an upgrade, I was told that there were no suites availabe during our stay. I was surprised to hear this given that I had booked the hotel early in February, so I checked with their online reservation desk and found that suites were available during our stay. I can only assume that the hotel did not want to provide someone traveling on reward points with a suite. That's disappointing considering my loyalty to the Priority Club brand of hotels and I would advise others traveling on points to check in advance as to the hotel's policy in this matter.
reviews.title: Not your typical Holiday Inn

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location, easy to walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. But, it's not your typical Holiday Inn: it's more like a New Orleans style hotel, with a central courtyard and rooms that surround the courtyard. It's old, but it has character and the pool area is very nice, nicely landscaped and good chairs and lounges. Internet is free, but there's a charge to park. They offer free popcorn, water, soft drinks and coffee in the am, but no breakfast.
reviews.title: Love this hotel - have made a return trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly situated. Not quite the center of town, but still walking distance to lots of cool shops, restaurants and coffee shops. Although it faces the main road, it is very quiet. As others have noted, the decor is a bit dated, but it has tons of character. The main lobby has lemonade, coffee, tea and popcorn going all the time. The hotel is laid out around a charming courtyard with a swimming pool and tropical gardens. There is a Ralph's supermarket right next door which opens early in the morning, and we loved being able to run over and grab some fresh fruit and a croissant for breakfast every morning, or a snack at the end of the day. We have stayed here a couple of times when we were visiting the Orange County area. There are some beautiful, much more expensive hotels in the area - but this is a great economical option to serve as base camp for your vacation.
reviews.title: Nice Service, Really Tired, Old Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We began with a great welcome. All workers were very nice, kind and accomodating. Great walking distance to all restaurants. The pool area is very pretty, and even though it was close to the main road, it was pretty quiet. However, the room we were in (and we were told we had a very nice room), was so old, tired and there literally was a "hole in the wall" by the bed. The phone and clock, where incredibly dirty (They did compensate for these things). We called it surfacy clean, if you looked close, there was a lot of grim on things. And, since all the doors are facing the outdoor area, it was pretty loud when people walked by or by the pool, however at night, the clientele was very quiet, and sleeping was good. I hate to be negative because the staff was so kind, but this place needs some major renovations quickly. Nice to have complimentary water, pop, popcorn, coffee and newspaper. It just wasn't enough to go back.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Laguna Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though this is an older property, it looks to be well maintained and the location is very convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and quiet. It's situated on the main street of Laguna, but far enough away from the noise and traffic of downtown. It's within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. There's a restaurant on the property for breakfast, but it's rather cave-like, so we decided to walk downtown and enjoy the perfect weather.
reviews.title: a very pleasant stay

reviews.text: This was a great little hotel. It is within walking distance of most of the shops and restaurants and access to public beach is just across the street. The rooms were great the pool is verry private and quite. All the employes were friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Laguna Beach Reunion

reviews.text: This hotel is great, the rooms are not new but they are well appointed and kept very clean. Located on the south side of Laguna Beach the hotel is close to most shops and there is a supermarket across the road. No real view from the hotel itself but there is a great atmosphere. We were upgraded to a suite on the third floor up the rear of the hotel. Not having a lift is one of the only drawbacks. The suits are huge with great bathrooms and a fireplace. Staff are friendly and have good knowledge of the local area. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Quiet and great value for money.

reviews.text: Other hotels in this area tend to be expensive, filthy or both but not this one. Clean, comfortable and a great staff! Free movie theater popcorn and lemonade, coffee, soda and bottled water for guests. Less than 10 minutes to the main beach and the smaller Cleo Street beach is across the street!
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Cute building but the room was extremely tired. Clean. In room phone did not work. Nice pool area
reviews.title: Not much
Worked out well for us
reviews.text: This hotel was good choice for our stay in Laguna Beach and the price was good too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in two different rooms because we asked to be moved to a room with a king bed as it would give us more room because we were traveling with a child and needed a crib. The rooms were very clean and seemed recently upgraded. They even wash the walls here when you leave a room, everything was really nice and no noise with the inner court yard. The pool temp was good. This place reminded me of New Orleans because of the inner courtyard.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.text: The rooms on one side are smaller but they get the morning sun the others are a bit bigger but no morning sun. We needed bigger because of the crib but would have prefered the sunny side other wise.It was cold when we arrived and we were worried that the room heater was not going to be enough heat for us as we were traveling with a child and they brought us an extra heater which was good for us. They came right away when we had any problems. We would have liked to stay in a suite but it was a walk up the stairs and no elevator so too much hassle for us with a kid a stroller. We looked at one and they were nice.
reviews.title: It was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is right across the street and down a few steps, we went everyday sometimes 2 or 3 times while we were here. It's great to walk down to the beach and head to the main beach and go to the shops or restaurants. They are many great places to eat here. All the little taco shops were great as well as all the fine dining establishments.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay in Laguna Beach

likes.disliked: — Bar / Restaurant - NOTE: It may not be directly associated with the hotel though, I'm not sure.

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the downstairs bar because no one else was and we read the reviews here. It seems like a fun place to hang out and meet locals.
reviews.title: No frills, Nice stay

description: The Holiday Inn Laguna Beach hotel is a beach resort located in the heart of Laguna Beach. It is nearby Laguna Hills, Newport Beach, Dana Point, Laguna Niguel, Huntington Beach, San Clemente, San Juan Capistrano and South Coast Plaza and minutes away from the pageant of the masters art festival. A French country decor hotel with rooms facing the heated pool which is surrounded by lush tropical landscaping. Across the street from the beach and within walking distance to all shops, restaurants and the famous art festivals. We have just completed renovation on all guest rooms, pool, lobby and the courtyard. The Mare Restaurant & Lounge is the hotel's restaurant. Sun drenched patios, shaded back patio in tropical settings, amazing food and nightly entertainment.
